member.name: T:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AssertionIDCache
member.summary: Provides a cache for recording previously used SAMLAssertion identifiers. The cache may be used when enforcing single use of SAML assertions.
member.remarks: The cache is implemented using the System.Web.Caching.Cache. Use of this cache is entirely optional. Refer to the System.Web.Caching.Cache documentation for usage restrictions.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AssertionIDCache.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds an assertion identifier to the cache. The assertion identifier cannot already exist in the cache.
member.returns: true if the assertion identifier was added to the cache; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AssertionIDCache.Add(ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.SAMLAssertion)
member.summary: Adds an assertion identifier to the cache. The assertion identifier cannot already exist in the cache.
member.remarks: If the SAML assertion includes a Conditions element with a NotOnOrAfter time then that value is used as the expiration time for the cache entry. Otherwise the default expiration time is used.
member.param: The SAML assertion whose identifier is to be cached.
member.returns: true if the entry was added in the cache; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AssertionIDCache.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether the assertion identifier is contained in the cache.
member.returns: true if the assertion identifier is contained in the cache; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AssertionIDCache.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an assertion identifier from the cache.

member.name: P:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AssertionIDCache.Expiration
member.summary: Gets or sets the expiration time span for cached assertion identifier entries.
member.value: The expiration time span for cached assertion identifier entries.

member.name: T:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AttributeType
member.summary: Represents the attribute type.
member.remarks: Refer to the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) V2.0 specification for further details.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AttributeType.RegisterAttributeValueSerializer(System.String,System.String,ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.IAttributeValueSerializer)
member.summary:
Registers an attribute value serializer for serializing attribute values to XML. Attribute value serializers are identified by attribute name and name format, both of which are optional.
If an attribute name and name format are specified then the serializer matches on both. If an attribute name is not specified then the serializer matches on attribute name format. If an attribute name format is not specified then the serializer matches on attribute name. If neither an attribute name nor name format are specified then the serializer matches all.
If there's no registered attribute value serializer then the default serializer is used and the attribute value is assumed to be a string.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AttributeType.DeregisterAttributeValueSerializer(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deregisters an attribute value serializer.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AttributeType.IsAttributeValueSerializerRegistered(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether the attribute value serializer is registered.
member.returns: true if the attribute value serializer is registered; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.AttributeType.GetAttributeValueSerializer(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the attribute value serializer for the specified attribute name and name format.
member.para: A match is first tried using both the attribute name and name format. If that fails then a match is tried on attribute name only. If that fails then a match is tried on attribute name format only. If no matches are found then the default serializer is returned.
member.returns: The attribute value serializer.

member.summary: Indicates whether the current UTC time is within the not before and not on or after period, if specified.
member.remarks: To be within the time period, not before > UTC now >= not on or after
member.returns: true if within the time period; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.Conditions.IsWithinTimePeriod(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current UTC time is within the not before and not on or after period, if specified. The supplied time span is to allow for clock skew.
member.remarks: To be within the time period, not before - clock skew > UTC now >= not on or after + clock skew
member.param: The time span to allow for clock skew.
member.returns: true if within the time period; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.EncryptedAssertion.#ctor(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EncryptedAssertion class from a SAML assertion XML.
member.remarks:
A random symmetric session key is generated from the public asymmetric key. The symmetric key is used to encrypt the data.
The encryption method for the encrypted symmetric key is http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5.
The encryption method for the data is http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#aes256-cbc.
member.param: The key info to include with the encrypted data.
member.exception: Thrown when the encryption fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.EncryptedAssertion.#ctor(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptionMethod,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EncryptedAssertion class from a SAML assertion XML.
member.remarks:
A random symmetric session key is generated from the public asymmetric key. The symmetric key is used to encrypt the data.
The encryption method for the encrypted symmetric key is http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5.
The specified data encryption method is used. For example, http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#aes256-cbc.
The supported data encryption methods are:
http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#tripledes-cbc
http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-tripledes
http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#aes128-cbc
http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-aes128
http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#aes192-cbc

http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#aes256-cbc
http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-aes256
member.param: The method for encrypting the data.
The key info to include with the encrypted data.
member.exception: Thrown when the encryption fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.EncryptedAssertion.DecryptToXml(System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm)
member.summary: Decrypts an encrypted assertion to XML.
member.remarks:
The asymmetric key is used to decrypt the symmetric key contained within the encrypted data. The symmetric key is used to decrypt the data.
The encryption method for the encrypted symmetric key is expected to be http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5 or http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-oaep-mgf1p.
The encryption method for the data is specified in the encrypted data.
This method should be used if the assertion includes a signature to be verified.
The supported key encryption methods are:

The method for decrypting the data or null if specified in the encrypted data.

Thrown when the decryption fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.SAMLAssertionSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature and adds it to the SAML assertion.
member.remarks:
An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the SAML assertion. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. The key info will be included in the signature.
The generated signature is added to the supplied XML element.
member.param: The key info to include in the signature.
The inclusive namespace prefix list or null to default to #default saml ds xs xsi.
The digest method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1.
The signature method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.summary: Indicates whether the current UTC time is within the not before and not on or after period, if specified.
member.remarks: To be within the time period, not before > UTC now >= not on or after
member.returns: true if within the time period; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Assertions.SubjectConfirmationData.IsWithinTimePeriod(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current UTC time is within the not before and not on or after period, if specified. The supplied time span is to allow for clock skew.
member.remarks: To be within the time period, not before - clock skew > UTC now >= not on or after + clock skew
member.param: The time span to allow for clock skew.
member.returns: true if within the time period; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Bindings.PAOSBinding.SendRequest(System.Web.HttpResponseBase,System.Xml.XmlElement)

member.remarks: The client can use this method to send an HTTP request and receive a SAML request from the service provider.

member.exception: Thrown when the receive fails.

member.name: P:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Configuration.PartnerIdentityProviderConfiguration.OverridePendingAuthnRequest
member.summary:
Gets or sets the flag indicating whether a pending authentication request may be overridden and an IdP-initiated SAML response received.
If a service provider sends an authentication request then it expects the SAML response it receives to come from the identity provider it sent the authentication request to and that the SAML response is in response to this authentication request. If a different identity provider sends a SAML response or the expected identity provider sends a SAML response but it is not in response to this authentication request, this is treated as an error if this flag is false. If this flag is true then these restrictions do not apply.
Setting this flag to true supports an SP-initiated SSO flow being supplanted by an IdP-initiated SSO.
member.value: The flag indicating whether a pending authentication request may be overridden.

member.value: The optional requested authentication context to include in the authn request.

member.summary: Gets or sets the optional provider name to include in the authn request.
member.value: The optional provider name to include in the authn request.

member.summary: Gets the dictionary of SAML configurations keyed by configuration ID.

member.name: P:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Configuration.SAMLConfiguration.ConfigurationID
member.summary:
Gets or sets the SAML configuration identifier.
For most applications, a single SAML configuration is used and the SAML configuration identifier is not required. For multi-tenanted applications and other special use cases with multiple SAML configurations, the SAML identifier specifies the configuration to use.
member.value: The SAML configuration identifier or null if none.

member.name: P:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Configuration.SAMLConfiguration.TraceLevel
member.summary:
Gets or sets the trace level.
The diagnostics section in web.config specifies the trace configuration. This includes the trace switch value which effectively turns verbose trace on or off. The trace level configuration property may be used to override the trace switch. If the trace level is not set then the trace switch is in effect. If the trace level is set then this overrides the trace switch.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Metadata.SAMLMetadataSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature and adds it to the metadata.
member.remarks:
An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the metadata. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. The key info will be included in the signature.
The generated signature is added to the supplied XML element.
member.param: The key info to include in the signature.
The inclusive namespace prefix list or null to default to #default md saml ds xs xsi.
The digest method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1.
The signature method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Metadata.SAMLMetadataSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature and adds it to the metadata.
member.remarks:
An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the metadata. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. The key info will be included in the signature.
The generated signature is added to the supplied XML element.
member.param: The key info to include in the signature.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Metadata.SAMLMetadataSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature and adds it to the metadata.
member.remarks:
An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the metadata. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. Key info, using the supplied X.509 data, is included in the signature.
The generated signature is added to the supplied XML element.
member.param: The X.509 data to include in the signature.
The inclusive namespace prefix list or null to default to #default md saml ds xs xsi.
The digest method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1.
The signature method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

The generated signature is added to the supplied XML element.
member.param: The X.509 data to include in the signature.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.summary: Generates an XML signature and adds it to the metadata.
member.remarks:
An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the metadata. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. Key info, using the supplied X.509 certificates, is included in the signature.

The signature method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.summary: The default inclusive namespace prefix list.

member.summary: Gets the ID from the SAML message.
member.returns: The ID.

member.summary: Adds the XML signature to the SAML message.

member.summary: Indicates whether the SAML message contains an XML signature.
member.returns: true if the XML contains an XML signature; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLMessageSignature.RemoveSignature(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Removes the XML signature, if any, from the SAML message.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLMessageSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature and adds it to the SAML message.
member.remarks:
An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the SAML message. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. The key info will be included in the signature.
The generated signature is added to the supplied XML element.
member.param: The key info to include in the signature.
The inclusive namespace prefix list or null to default to #default samlp saml ds xs xsi.
The digest method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1.
The signature method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLMessageSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature and adds it to the SAML message.
member.remarks:
An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the SAML message. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. The key info will be included in the signature.
The generated signature is added to the supplied XML element.
member.param: The key info to include in the signature.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLMessageSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature and adds it to the SAML message.
member.remarks:
An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the SAML message. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. Key info, using the supplied X.509 data, is included in the signature.
The generated signature is added to the supplied XML element.
member.param: The X.509 data to include in the signature.
The inclusive namespace prefix list or null to default to #default samlp saml ds xs xsi.
The digest method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1.
The signature method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.remarks:
An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the SAML message. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. Key info, using the supplied X.509 data, is included in the signature.
The generated signature is added to the supplied XML element.
member.param: The X.509 data to include in the signature.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.summary: Generates an XML signature and adds it to the SAML message.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SAMLResponse class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SAMLResponse class from XML.
member.exception: Thrown when the XML deserialization fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLResponse.GetAssertion
member.summary:
Returns the SAML assertion.
It's assumed the SAML response contains a single unencrypted, unsigned SAML assertion.
To get the signed assertion use GetSignedAssertion. To get the encrypted assertion use GetEncryptedAssertion.
member.returns: The SAML assertion or null if none.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLResponse.GetSignedAssertion(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.summary:
Returns the SAML assertion.
It's assumed the SAML response contains a single signed SAML assertion.
To get the unencrypted, unsigned assertion use GetAssertion. To get the encrypted assertion use GetEncryptedAssertion.
member.returns: The SAML assertion or null if none.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature verification fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLResponse.GetEncryptedAssertion
member.summary:
Returns the encrypted SAML assertion.
It's assumed the SAML response contains a single encrypted SAML assertion.
To get the unencrypted, unsigned assertion use GetAssertion. To get the signed assertion use GetSignedAssertion.
member.returns: The encrypted assertion or null if none.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLResponse.GetAssertions
member.summary:
Returns all unencrypted, unsigned assertions.
To get the signed assertions use GetSignedAssertions. To get the encrypted assertions use GetEncryptedAssertions.
member.returns: The assertions.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLResponse.GetSignedAssertions
member.summary:
Returns all signed assertions.
To get the unencrypted, unsigned assertions use GetAssertions. To get the encrypted assertions use GetEncryptedAssertions.
member.returns: The signed assertions.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLResponse.GetEncryptedAssertions
member.summary:
Returns all encrypted assertions.
To get the unencrypted, unsigned assertions use GetAssertions. To get the signed assertions use GetSignedAssertions.
member.returns: The encrypted assertions.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLResponse.ToXml
member.summary: Serializes the SAML response to XML.
member.remarks: An XML document is created.
member.returns: The SAML response as XML.
member.exception: Thrown when the XML serialization fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLResponse.ToXml(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Serializes the SAML response to XML.
member.returns: The SAML response as XML.
member.exception: Thrown when the XML serialization fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLResponse.ToString
member.summary: Converts the SAML response to a string.
member.returns: The SAML response as a string.

member.name: P:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Protocols.SAMLResponse.Assertions
member.summary:
Gets or sets the assertions.
This includes all unsigned, signed and encrypted assertions.
The list may contain unencrypted and unsigned SAML assertions as SAMLAssertion objects, signed SAML assertions as XmlElement objects, and encrypted SAML assertions as EncryptedAssertion objects.
To get just the unencrypted, unsigned assertions use GetAssertions. To get just the signed assertions use GetSignedAssertions. To get just the encrypted assertions use GetEncryptedAssertions.

member.name: T:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider
member.summary: Provides Identity Provider (IdP) support for web browser single sign-on.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider.IsSSO
member.summary: Indicates whether the identity provider is currently single signed-on to a service provider.
member.returns: true if currently single signed-on; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider.IsSSO(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether the identity provider is currently single signed-on to a service provider.
member.returns: true if currently single signed-on; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider.IsSendSSOPending
member.summary:
Indicates whether single sign-on to a service provider is pending.
Single sign-on is pending if an authn request has been received from a service provider and a SAML response is pending.
member.returns: true if single sign-on is pending; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider.IsSendSSOPending(System.String)
member.summary:
Indicates whether single sign-on to a service provider is pending.
Single sign-on is pending if an authn request has been received from the service provider and a SAML response is pending.
member.returns: true if single sign-on is pending; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider.IsSendSLOPending
member.summary:
Indicates whether a single logout response to a service provider is pending.
Single logout is pending if a logout request has been received from a service provider and a logout response is pending.
member.returns: true if single logout is pending; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider.IsSendSLOPending(System.String)
member.summary:
Indicates whether a single logout response to a service provider is pending.
Single logout is pending if a logout request has been received from a service provider and a logout response is pending.
member.returns: true if single logout is pending; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider.IsReceiveSLOPending
member.summary:
Indicates whether a single logout response from a service provider is pending.
Single logout is pending if a logout request has been sent to a service provider and a logout response is pending.
member.returns: true if single logout is pending; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider.IsReceiveSLOPending(System.String)
member.summary:
Indicates whether a single logout response from a service provider is pending.
Single logout is pending if a logout request has been sent to a service provider and a logout response is pending.
member.returns: true if single logout is pending; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider.GetPartnerPendingResponse
member.summary: Gets the name of the partner service provider to which a single sign-on or logout response is pending.
member.returns: The name of the partner service provider or null if none.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.SAMLIdentityProvider.InitiateSSO(System.Web.HttpResponseBase,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Initiates single sign-on from the identity provider to the service provider (ie. IdP-initiated SSO).
A SAML response containing a SAML assertion is sent to the service provider.
member.param: The user name to include in the SAML assertion.
The relay state (eg target URL) or null if none.
member.exception: Thrown when the single sign-on fails.

member.summary: The SAML version.

member.summary: Creates an identifier by prefixing a generated GUID with an underscore.

member.summary: Converts the XML into a base-64 encoded string.
member.returns: The base-64 encoded string.

member.summary: Converts the base-64 encoded string into XML.
member.returns: The XML.
member.exception: Thrown when the conversion fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.SAML.ToDateTime(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the DateTime represented by the formatted date/time string.
member.remarks:
The date/time string should be formatted as: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ.
As per the SAML specification, all date/time values should be coordinated universal time (UTC).
member.returns: The DateTime.
member.exception: Thrown when the conversion fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.SAML.ToDateTimeString(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns a date/time string formatted as: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ.
member.remarks: As per the SAML specification, all date/time values should be coordinated universal time (UTC).
member.returns: The formatted string.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.SAML.ToDateTimeString
member.summary: Returns the current UTC date/time formatted as: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ.
member.returns: The formatted string.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.SAML.ToBoolean(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the boolean value represented by a string.
member.remarks: Valid values, as defined by the XML schema specification, are "true", "false", "1", "0".
member.returns: The boolean.
member.exception: Thrown when the boolean string value is illegal.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.SAML.ToXmlElement(System.String)
member.summary: Loads an XML element from an XML string.
member.returns: The XML element.
member.exception: Thrown when the XML deserialization fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.SAML.ToAbsoluteURL(System.String)
member.summary:
Converts a rooted URL to an absolute URL.
A rooted URL starts with the tilde (~) character.
The call must be made in the context of processing an HTTP request.
member.returns: The absolute URL.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.SAML.RemoveUnicodeMarkerCharacters(System.String)
member.summary:
Removes unicode marker characters from the string.
0x200E is the left-to-right marker.
0x200F is the right-to-left marker.
member.returns: The string with unicode marker characters stripped.

member.name: P:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.SAML.MillisecondPrecision
member.summary:
Gets or sets the flag indicating whether or not times should have millisecond precision when being serialized to XML.
For example, a time with millisecond precision is 06:33:14.729 whereas a time without millisecond precision is 06:33:14.
The default is true.
member.value: The flag indicating whether or not times should have millisecond precision.

member.name: T:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSchema
member.summary: Provides common XML schema definitions and helper methods.
member.remarks: Refer to the W3C XML Schema specification for further details.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSchema.GetQualifiedSimpleType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the qualified simple type by prefixing it with the XML schema prefix. For example, the qualified simple type for "string" is "xs:string".
member.param: The simple type to be qualified.
member.returns: The qualified simple type.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSchema.GetSimpleType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the simple type by removing the XML schema prefix from the qualified name. For example, the simple type for "xs:string" is "string".
member.returns: The simple type.

member.name: T:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSignature
member.summary: Supports XML signature generation and verification.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSignature.GetSigningKeyFromKeyInfo(System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo)
member.summary: Gets the signing key from the key info.
member.returns: The signing key or null if none.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSignature.PrepareForSignatureVerification(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: If the signed element isn't the document element then signature verification can fail. This appears to be an issue with namespace management but it's unclear precisely what the problem is. It's suspected that there's a problem with the .NET SignedXml class. As a workaround, all namespaces used within the XML are declared on the document element and the element is cloned to a new document. This works for both .NET and Java generated signatures.
member.returns: The XML prepared for signature verification.

member.summary: Gets the signature element from the XML.
member.param: The XML containing the signature element.
member.returns: The signature element or null if none.

member.summary: Indicates whether the XML includes a signature element.
member.returns: true if the XML includes a signature element; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSignature.RemoveSignature(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Removes the signature element from the XML.
member.param: The XML containing the signature element.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature.
member.remarks: An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the XML. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. The key info will be included in the signature.
member.param: The ID of the signed XML.
The key info to include in the signature.
The XML signature inclusive namespace prefix list or null.
The digest method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1.
The signature method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1.
member.returns: The XML signature.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature.
member.remarks: An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the XML. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. Key info, using the supplied X.509 data, is included in the signature.
member.param: The ID of the signed XML.
The X.509 data to include in the signature.
The XML signature inclusive namespace prefix list.
The digest method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1.
The signature method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1.
member.returns: The XML signature.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature.
member.remarks: An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the XML. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. Key info, using the supplied X.509 certificates, is included in the signature.
member.param: The ID of the signed XML.
The list of X.509 certificate to include in the key info.
The XML signature inclusive namespace prefix list.
The digest method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1.
The signature method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1.
member.returns: The XML signature.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature.
member.remarks: An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the XML. The signature is created using the supplied signing key. Key info, using the supplied X.509 certificate, is included in the signature.
member.param: The ID of the signed XML.
The X.509 certificate to include in the key info.
The XML signature inclusive namespace prefix list.
The digest method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1.
The signature method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1.
member.returns: The XML signature.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature generation fails.

member.name: M:ComponentSpace.SAML2.Utility.XmlSignature.Generate(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an XML signature.
member.remarks: An XML signature with the constraints specified in the SAML specification is generated and added to the XML. The signature is created using the supplied signing key.
member.param: The ID of the signed XML.
The XML signature inclusive namespace prefix list.
The digest method or null to default to http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1.
